segment.source: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change (Windows 10)
segment.target: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for certain IPsec and Windows Filtering Platform actions.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes the Advanced Security Audit policy setting, Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change, which determines whether the operating system generates audit events for certain IPsec and Windows Filtering Platform actions.

segment.source: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change
segment.target: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016
segment.target: Windows Server 2016

segment.source: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change allows you to audit events generated by changes to the Windows Filtering Platform (WFP), such as the following:
segment.target: Audit Filtering Platform Policy Change allows you to audit events generated by changes to the Windows Filtering Platform (WFP), such as the following:

segment.source: IPsec services status.
segment.target: IPsec services status.

segment.source: Changes to IPsec policy settings.
segment.target: Changes to IPsec policy settings.

segment.source: Changes to Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine policy settings.
segment.target: Changes to Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine policy settings.

segment.source: Changes to WFP providers and engine.
segment.target: Changes to WFP providers and engine.

segment.source: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).
segment.target: Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) enables independent software vendors (ISVs) to filter and modify TCP/IP packets, monitor or authorize connections, filter Internet Protocol security (IPsec)-protected traffic, and filter remote procedure calls (RPCs).

segment.source: This subcategory is outside the scope of this document.
segment.target: This subcategory is outside the scope of this document.

segment.source: 4709(S): IPsec Services was started.
segment.target: 4709(S): IPsec Services was started.

segment.source: 4710(S): IPsec Services was disabled.
segment.target: 4710(S): IPsec Services was disabled.

segment.source: 4711(S): May contain any one of the following:
segment.target: 4711(S): May contain any one of the following:

segment.source: 4712(F): IPsec Services encountered a potentially serious failure.
segment.target: 4712(F): IPsec Services encountered a potentially serious failure.

segment.source: 5040(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5040(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: An Authentication Set was added.
segment.target: An Authentication Set was added.

segment.source: 5041(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5041(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: An Authentication Set was modified.
segment.target: An Authentication Set was modified.

segment.source: 5042(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5042(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: An Authentication Set was deleted.
segment.target: An Authentication Set was deleted.

segment.source: 5043(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5043(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Connection Security Rule was added.
segment.target: A Connection Security Rule was added.

segment.source: 5044(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5044(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Connection Security Rule was modified.
segment.target: A Connection Security Rule was modified.

segment.source: 5045(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5045(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Connection Security Rule was deleted.
segment.target: A Connection Security Rule was deleted.

segment.source: 5046(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5046(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Crypto Set was added.
segment.target: A Crypto Set was added.

segment.source: 5047(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5047(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Crypto Set was modified.
segment.target: A Crypto Set was modified.

segment.source: 5048(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.
segment.target: 5048(S): A change has been made to IPsec settings.

segment.source: A Crypto Set was deleted.
segment.target: A Crypto Set was deleted.

segment.source: 5440(S): The following callout was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.
segment.target: 5440(S): The following callout was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.

segment.source: 5441(S): The following filter was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.
segment.target: 5441(S): The following filter was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.

segment.source: 5442(S): The following provider was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.
segment.target: 5442(S): The following provider was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.

segment.source: 5443(S): The following provider context was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.
segment.target: 5443(S): The following provider context was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.

segment.source: 5444(S): The following sub-layer was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.
segment.target: 5444(S): The following sub-layer was present when the Windows Filtering Platform Base Filtering Engine started.

segment.source: 5446(S): A Windows Filtering Platform callout has been changed.
segment.target: 5446(S): A Windows Filtering Platform callout has been changed.

segment.source: 5448(S): A Windows Filtering Platform provider has been changed.
segment.target: 5448(S): A Windows Filtering Platform provider has been changed.

segment.source: 5449(S): A Windows Filtering Platform provider context has been changed.
segment.target: 5449(S): A Windows Filtering Platform provider context has been changed.

segment.source: 5450(S): A Windows Filtering Platform sub-layer has been changed.
segment.target: 5450(S): A Windows Filtering Platform sub-layer has been changed.

segment.source: 5456(S): PAStore Engine applied Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5456(S): PAStore Engine applied Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5457(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5457(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5458(S): PAStore Engine applied locally cached copy of Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5458(S): PAStore Engine applied locally cached copy of Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5459(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply locally cached copy of Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5459(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply locally cached copy of Active Directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5460(S): PAStore Engine applied local registry storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5460(S): PAStore Engine applied local registry storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5461(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply local registry storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5461(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply local registry storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5462(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply some rules of the active IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5462(F): PAStore Engine failed to apply some rules of the active IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.
segment.target: Use the IP Security Monitor snap-in to diagnose the problem.

segment.source: 5463(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the active IPsec policy and detected no changes.
segment.target: 5463(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the active IPsec policy and detected no changes.

segment.source: 5464(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the active IPsec policy, detected changes, and applied them to IPsec Services.
segment.target: 5464(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the active IPsec policy, detected changes, and applied them to IPsec Services.

segment.source: 5465(S): PAStore Engine received a control for forced reloading of IPsec policy and processed the control successfully.
segment.target: 5465(S): PAStore Engine received a control for forced reloading of IPsec policy and processed the control successfully.

segment.source: 5466(F): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory cannot be reached, and will use the cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy instead.
segment.target: 5466(F): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory cannot be reached, and will use the cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy instead.

segment.source: Any changes made to the Active Directory IPsec policy since the last poll could not be applied.
segment.target: Any changes made to the Active Directory IPsec policy since the last poll could not be applied.

segment.source: 5467(F): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory can be reached, and found no changes to the policy.
segment.target: 5467(F): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory can be reached, and found no changes to the policy.

segment.source: The cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy is no longer being used.
segment.target: The cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy is no longer being used.

segment.source: 5468(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory can be reached, found changes to the policy, and applied those changes.
segment.target: 5468(S): PAStore Engine polled for changes to the Active Directory IPsec policy, determined that Active Directory can be reached, found changes to the policy, and applied those changes.

segment.source: The cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy is no longer being used.
segment.target: The cached copy of the Active Directory IPsec policy is no longer being used.

segment.source: 5471(S): PAStore Engine loaded local storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5471(S): PAStore Engine loaded local storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5472(F): PAStore Engine failed to load local storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5472(F): PAStore Engine failed to load local storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5473(S): PAStore Engine loaded directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5473(S): PAStore Engine loaded directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5474(F): PAStore Engine failed to load directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.
segment.target: 5474(F): PAStore Engine failed to load directory storage IPsec policy on the computer.

segment.source: 5477(F): PAStore Engine failed to add quick mode filter.
segment.target: 5477(F): PAStore Engine failed to add quick mode filter.
